Topic.Title: SPEEA - only one person to blame and that's Ray Goforth

Message.Msg: Try not to confuse badmouthing the union with criticizing and calling out the SPEEA leadership. Shuper is right - Goforth and his cronies are lunatic fringe that have no sense of balance as it pertains to reasonable discourse and negotiation with Boeing mgmt. The Eng/Tech's got an unprecedented salary increase and he still recommended voting down the offer - that's absurd. He made the pension issue a make or break deal when, in fact, it didn't pertain to anyone already in the union! All he succeeded in doing was kicking the hornets nest. Now look what's happening to Puget Sound engineering org's - they're moving out of town - and I don't blame mgmt. one bit for doing it. SPEEA needs to wake up and get rid of this guy.

Topic.Title: SPEEA - only one person to blame and that's Ray Goforth

Message.Msg: Thank you ba nonsense- FYI- a decade ago, another person posting here had similar comments Re: Say WHAT ?? by: migit_minded_managers 08/02/02 11:36 am Msg: 172570 of 426164 Tincanguy, Your assessment of SPEEA is based on a false premise. That makes it difficult to understand why Shuper is opposed to its current structure. The confusion can be found in how you characterized what is happening. You stated that Day and Dunn and their small group of malcontents are hell-bent on destroying the substantial power that SPEEA has acquired in the past few years. Later in your statement you give credit to the leaders of the union for being responsible for turning SPEEA into a real union. That is the key to your misunderstanding. It was the members as well as the non-members who made this a union with teeth. Bofferding has never done anything for the union. He has worked for himself. It was those that SPEEA was supposed to represent that made this a real union. Everybody else just jumped on the bandwagon and have taken credit for what the members and non-members did, in opposition to what the leadership recommended we do. It achieved quite the opposite of what the leadership thought we could do. Remember that Bofferding recommended both contracts that the company offered last time. The membership rejected both. Bofferding said we had to accept the offer because a strike would fail. He said there were all the non-members who would not join in a strike. He was wrong. He was way out of touch with the membership because he only cares about himself. Those who voted for Day did so because they wanted Bofferding out. That was the first step. Day was known to oppose Bofferding.

Topic.Title: SPEEA - only one person to blame and that's Ray Goforth

Message.Msg: Most of those I spoke to on the strike lines had no affection for Bofferding. Those who did surprised me with their naivety. They pointed to his bringing in the big boys as key to our building strength. That isn't what happened. The big boys didn't want to look foolish for ignoring this little band of engineers who were bringing a DOW 30 company to its knees without their assistance. The big boys didn't want to be relegated to a role of being insignificant. They HAD to join in to keep themselves viable. While there are many examples of how Bofferding has manipulated the union and its staff to meet his needs, the real key to his disservice to the membership is that he was surprised by the membership's rebuke of his lackeys in the last vote and felt threatened - as well he should be. Then, rather than consider the needs of the many, and the negotiations soon to take place. he orchestrated the most devisive action he could, solely to eliminate the competition which threatened his dictatorship. Regardless of what you hear, Bofferding is behind the recall. Thr result of these actions is to split the membership. The turnout for the recall vote was larger than the initial vote. While the recall effort was a success it may well prove to be a failure. The vote was close and many of those who opposed the recall have stated their willingness to sign for decertification, should the opportunity present itself. How much more destructive can one be?

Topic.Title: SPEEA - only one person to blame and that's Ray Goforth

Message.Msg: Thr result of these actions is to split the membership. The turnout for the recall vote was larger than the initial vote. While the recall effort was a success it may well prove to be a failure. The vote was close and many of those who opposed the recall have stated their willingness to sign for decertification, should the opportunity present itself. How much more destructive can one be? This doesn't do much more than scratch the surface, but it should give you some basic understanding of what is going on among the active membership and why those who support the basic concept of union representation and strong unions would oppose their own union. Shuper doesn't oppose SPEEA. Shuper opposes the way SPEEA is controlled and manipulated for the benefit of one, in the guise of being good for everyone else. Millions and millions of people have been duped by that argument before and no doubt will be in the future. People are basically sheep. They follow the leader and refuse to acknowledge the shortcomings of those leaders until they discover too late the truth. The current stock market is a good example of the masses buying into what the leaders proclaim - not dicsovering the truth until it cost them more than they would have been willing to pay if the facts were clearly laid out.. Posted as a reply to: Msg 172533 by tincanguy

Message.Title: 787 outlook for June
Message.Msg: From NYC787 site: I am expecting deliveries for June to be higher than May with at least 14 if not more 787s being delivered to customers. Here's my prediction for June: Aeromexico (ILFC)* - 1 Air India - 1 ANA - 2 British Airways* - 2 China Southern - 1 Hainan Airlines* - 2 LOT Polish - 1 Japan Airlines - 1 Norwegian (ILFC)* - 1 Qatar Airways - 1 Thomson Airways - 1 Many of the airplanes that would be slated for delivery in June already have had their B-1 flight or more. 4 customers will be receiving their first 787s this month as well.

Message.Title: JAL Dreamliner Grounded After Sensor Glitch, Kyodo News Says
Message.Msg: A problem with an air-pressure sensor on a battery container in a Japan Airlines Co. (9201) 787 Dreamliner made by Boeing (BA) Co. caused the airline to use another plane for a Tokyo-to-Beijing flight, according to Kyodo News. Japan Airlines said the sensor showed a difference in air pressure between the outside and inside of the container during a safety check before the departure of Flight 21 from Tokyo’s Haneda airport, the news network reported. Yesterday, Japan Airlines and ANA Holdings Inc. (9202) restarted Dreamliner flights. The twin-engine jetliner, the first built chiefly of composite materials, was grounded for more than four months because of battery malfunctions. Susan Bradley, a spokeswoman for Chicago-based Boeing, said that the company was aware of the issue and was working on it with the airline. So Boeing admits the 787 is still a failure or laugh now still teething after 4 year delay and 3 month more to fix the problem laugh now , it has been a few days of resumption of 787 flights . As I have said numerous times, the 787 is not , any time soon done teething, because the engineering control for the plane was not done by Boeing Seattle USA engineers .

Topic.Title: outlook for June

Message.Msg: Here is a time capsule that I said when the 787 was only 3 years late , how am I doing !"The urgent need is to keep China out and build a better plane than Airbus. So Boeing with the 3 year 787 delay, has allowed the both the new Airbus plane and the Chinese with their C919 airplane to catch up and is going to be able to compete with the 737. The new 737 ( MAX) cannot be built until the 787 is working. Much of the technology of the 787 will be used on the 737 if it works. I think the sizzle of composite, especially for the wing is not ready and Boeing has blown a huge lead to nothing. Frankly, the 787 concept was flawed with a 100% integrator model at the same time as Boeing went from aluminum to composite, and also allowed too much engineering to be done by the contractors, with a final shot in the head by not keeping tight control over their contractor progress, a perfect failure on the heads of risk taking Executives. So if the gamble worked Airbus and China would have copied it. There was no need to get risky; Boeing should have made the other players take the gamble and watch. Now the program is in dire straits and the opportunity to be conservative and use 100 years of skill, knowledge and ability of the IAM and SPEEA workers is only now being deployed like it should have been in the start. The 787 is a 10 year project and is 3 years behind schedule or 2WWII time periods. The Sonic Cruiser project was finally abandoned by December 2002 in favor of the slower but more fuel-efficient 7E7 (later renamed Boeing 787 Dreamliner).[8] Much of the research from the Sonic Cruiser was applied to the 787, including carbon fiber reinforced plastic for the fuselage and wings, bleedless engines, cockpit and avionics design.[9]

Topic.Title: Boeings batteries

Message.Msg: Japan Airlines Co. said it had to replace a Boeing Co. 787 with another plane after a sensor indicated a problem with the Dreamliner’s battery box. Tape covering two holes used to regulate airflow in case of a battery fault in the auxiliary power unit was not removed after testing, triggering the alert, JAL said in a statement today. “The battery showed no abnormality,” it added. ... it looks like the sensors do work - perhaps a bit sensitive But that is GOOD news ! \

Topic.Title: Fewer Americans Call Themselves Economic Conservatives

Message.Msg: I include myself among a group of scientists that are considered "lukewarmers" with respect to climate change. I once was a warmist but the science now only supports a transient climate response of 1.3 degreesC for a doubling of CO2. The Paleocllimate records show short term warming periods where temperatures rose 10 degreesC in as little as 50 years prior to the industrial age. Do you think you will die from a 0.5 degreeC temperature increase over the next 70 years? What is it actually that you fear about climate change?

Topic.Title: JoeDokes25 hates unions, blames them, not boeing mangment

Message.Msg: as a Teamster working on the Seattle waterfront we went out on strike for just over a month. The president and other officers brought represented workings to the tabled and cheered victory we got what we demanded. Then we listened to the cheering and howling for several minutes then we got around the the numbers. No change on medical or dental, we did get an hourly wasge raise of .05. We figured we would have to work for 100 years to get the money back.

Message.Title: Yahoo Email ..We will read your email and Tuff Toe Nails if you dont like it !
Message.Msg: As of June 1, all Yahoo email users are required to upgrade to the company’s newest platform, which allows Yahoo to scan and analyze every email they write or receive. According to Yahoo’s help page, all users who make the transition agree to let the company perform “content scanning and analyzing of your communications content” to target ads, offer products, and perform “abuse protection.” Concerned..You should be.....Get Startmail which is completely protected...(Google Start mail home for more details) If you are reading this..you are the resistence

Topic.Title: Yahoo Email ..We will read your email and Tuff Toe Nails if you dont like it !

Message.Msg: “Emailing through Yahoo means surrendering your privacy, whether it’s your own account or your friend’s,” says Harvard-trained privacy expert Katherine Albrecht, who is helping to develop StartMail, an upcoming email service that will not scan its users’ correspondence. “It’s time we start paying attention to these policies, because they’re growing more shockingly abusive every day,” she added.

Topic.Title: HOLDER downgraded to MOSES !!

Message.Msg: Don, I imagine that some folks simply do not understand what they are saying. And in the case of MSNBC's equation between Holder and Moses, it is just such an example of that. So, I will grant pure ignorance in their case. But, to be equated with Moses is in the extreme that should invoke much scorn. There are only a small number, less than a handful, of persons in the Old and New Testaments whose death and transition to Heaven were heralded: Enoch (great grand father of Noah, Genesis 5); Moses (Deuteronomy 34); Elijah (2 Kings 2); and Jesus (Acts 1). Except for Moses, the others were translated directly to Heaven from their earthly domain. In the case of Moses, he was lovingly and carefully buried by the Lord Himself (Deuteronomy 34:6). Moses had spent so much time with the Lord directly that he had taken on such a radiance, a glow, that people could not stand it. Thus, Moses had to wear a veil (Exodus 34) when he was among the people. I guess I do not see any resemblance between Moses and Holder. BB
